content: one-row shawl materials needed  fingering weight yarn  h 5 mm hook  yarn needle special stitches/notations  v double_crochet ch1 double_crochet all in same stitch  double_crochet in v work a double_crochet into the chain space of the v beneath it from the previous row  v in double_crochet work a v into the lone double_crochet beneath it from the previous row  spine increase double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet all in one st this shawl is literally one row okay not exactly apart from the first two row which set up the pattern there is only one row that you really need to remember and then you crochet that row over and over again pattern is written in back and forth row so you will turn after each row as always i love my no turning chain double_crochet tutorial on youtube so my pattern does not note a turning chain if you do not know how to do the no turning chain double_crochet or if you simply prefer not to you may substitute with ch3 begin with spine increase in next double_crochet ch1 v in last double_crochet of spine increase from row 2 ch1 double_crochet in v ch1 v in next to last double_crochet ch1 v in last double_crochet row 4 v in first double_crochet ch1 v in next double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in v ch1 v in double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in v v in first double_crochet of spine increase from row 2 ch1 spine increase in next double_crochet ch1 v in last double_crochet of spine increase from row 3 double_crochet in v ch1 v in double_crochet ch1 double_crochet in v ch1 v in next to last double_crochet ch1 v in last double_crochet repeat row 4 obviously accounting for the fact that the row will be getting longer to desired length weave in ends and block with reckless abandon basically every row starts and ends with two vs each going into the dcs of the v in the row beneath it each row alternates between double_crochet and v with a chain separating everything… dcs go in vs and vs go in dcs the spine increase is worked into the middle double_crochet from the previous spine increase behold my crudely-drawn yet fancifully color-coded chart as a variation to make a heavier version of this shawl replace all vs not including the ones at the beginning and end of the row with a shell double_crochet double_crochet ch1 double_crochet double_crochet all in same st and eliminate the chains on either side of the
